import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch

# Mock the function's environment with patched constants
class TestCheckRssAddress(unittest.TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        self.patcher1 = patch('module.ALLOWED_SCHEMES', {'http', 'https'})
        self.patcher2 = patch('module.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', {'trusted1.com', 'trusted2.org', 'example.com'})
        self.patcher3 = patch('module.INTERNAL_IP_PATTERNS', [
            '^10[.]',
            '^172[.](1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])[.]',
            '^192[.]168[.]',
            '[.]internal$',
            '[.]local$',
            '^127[.]',
            '^localhost$'
        ])
        self.patcher1.start()
        self.patcher2.start()
        self.patcher3.start()
        from module import check_rss_address
        self.func = check_rss_address

    def tearDown(self):
        self.patcher1.stop()
        self.patcher2.stop()
        self.patcher3.stop()

    def test_valid_http_url(self):
        # Test valid HTTP URL with trusted provider
        url = 'http://trusted1.com/feed'
        result = self.func(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_valid_https_url(self):
        # Test valid HTTPS URL with trusted provider
        url = 'https://example.com/rss'
        result = self.func(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_valid_url_with_port(self):
        # Test valid URL with port number
        url = 'http://trusted2.org:8080/feed'
        result = self.func(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_invalid_scheme(self):
        # Test URL with invalid scheme (ftp)
        url = 'ftp://trusted1.com/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_untrusted_provider(self):
        # Test URL from untrusted provider
        url = 'http://untrusted.com/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_internal_ip_10(self):
        # Test internal IP in 10.0.0.0/8 range
        url = 'http://10.0.0.1/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_internal_ip_172(self):
        # Test internal IP in 172.16.0.0/12 range
        url = 'http://172.16.0.1/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_internal_ip_192(self):
        # Test internal IP in 192.168.0.0/16 range
        url = 'http://192.168.1.1/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_internal_domain_internal(self):
        # Test domain ending with .internal
        url = 'http://website.internal/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_localhost(self):
        # Test localhost domain
        url = 'http://localhost/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_127_0_0_1(self):
        # Test 127.0.0.1
        url = 'http://127.0.0.1/feed'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test non-string input (None)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            self.func(None)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string input
        url = ''
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            self.func(url)

    def test_trusted_domain_with_digit_10(self):
        # Test trusted domain containing '10' not matching IP pattern
        with patch('module.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', {'trusted10.com'}):
            url = 'http://trusted10.com/feed'
            result = self.func(url)
            self.assertEqual(result, url)

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch

class TestFilterRssFeed(unittest.TestCase):
    @classmethod
    def setUpClass(cls):
        # Patch constants in the target module
        cls.patcher_allowed = patch('solution.ALLOWED_SCHEMES', {'http', 'https'})
        cls.patcher_trusted = patch('solution.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', {'trusted1.com', 'trusted2.org', 'example.com', '8.8.8.8'})
        internal_patterns = [
            '^10\.\\d{1,3}\\.\\d{1,3}\\.\\d{1,3}$',
            '^192\.168\\.\\d{1,3}\\.\\d{1,3}$',
            '^172\\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])\\.\\d{1,3}\\.\\d{1,3}$'
        ]
        cls.patcher_internal = patch('solution.INTERNAL_IP_PATTERNS', internal_patterns)
        cls.patcher_allowed.start()
        cls.patcher_trusted.start()
        cls.patcher_internal.start()

    @classmethod
    def tearDownClass(cls):
        # Stop all patchers
        cls.patcher_allowed.stop()
        cls.patcher_trusted.stop()
        cls.patcher_internal.stop()

    def test_valid_http(self):
        # Test valid URL with http scheme and trusted host
        url = 'http://trusted1.com'
        self.assertEqual(filter_rss_feed(url), url)

    def test_valid_https(self):
        # Test valid URL with https scheme and trusted host
        url = 'https://trusted1.com'
        self.assertEqual(filter_rss_feed(url), url)

    def test_valid_with_port(self):
        # Test valid URL with port number
        url = 'http://trusted1.com:8080'
        self.assertEqual(filter_rss_feed(url), url)

    def test_valid_with_path_query(self):
        # Test valid URL with path and query
        url = 'http://trusted1.com/path?query=value'
        self.assertEqual(filter_rss_feed(url), url)

    def test_valid_ip_trusted(self):
        # Test valid URL with trusted IP address
        url = 'http://8.8.8.8'
        self.assertEqual(filter_rss_feed(url), url)

    def test_invalid_scheme(self):
        # Test invalid scheme (ftp)
        url = 'ftp://trusted1.com'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")

    def test_untrusted_host(self):
        # Test untrusted host
        url = 'http://untrusted.com'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_internal_ip_10(self):
        # Test internal IP (10.0.0.1)
        url = 'http://10.0.0.1'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_internal_ip_192(self):
        # Test internal IP (192.168.1.1)
        url = 'http://192.168.1.1'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_internal_ip_172(self):
        # Test internal IP (172.16.0.1)
        url = 'http://172.16.0.1'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_untrusted_ip(self):
        # Test untrusted public IP (1.2.3.4)
        url = 'http://1.2.3.4'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_host_with_10_prefix_but_domain(self):
        # Test domain that starts with '10.' but is not an IP
        url = 'http://10.trusted.com'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string as URL
        url = ''
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")

    def test_none(self):
        # Test None as URL
        url = None
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            filter_rss_feed(url)

    def test_non_string(self):

        url = 123

    def test_url_with_no_host(self):

        url = 'http://'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            filter_rss_feed(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch

class TestValidateFeedURL(unittest.TestCase):

    def setUp(self):
        self.patcher_allowed = patch('feed_utils.ALLOWED_SCHEMES', ['http', 'https'])
        self.patcher_trusted = patch('feed_utils.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', {'trusted.com', 'example.org'})
        self.patcher_internal = patch('feed_utils.INTERNAL_IP_PATTERNS', [r'^10\.', r'^192\.168\.', r'^172\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])\.'])
        self.patcher_allowed.start()
        self.patcher_trusted.start()
        self.patcher_internal.start()

    def tearDown(self):
        self.patcher_allowed.stop()
        self.patcher_trusted.stop()
        self.patcher_internal.stop()

    def test_valid_http_url(self):
        # Happy path: http and trusted host
        url = "http://trusted.com/rss"
        result = validate_feed_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_valid_https_url(self):
        # Happy path: https and trusted host
        url = "https://example.org/rss"
        result = validate_feed_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_invalid_scheme_ftp(self):
        # Invalid scheme: ftp
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("ftp://trusted.com/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")

    def test_untrusted_host(self):
        # Host not in trusted set
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://untrusted.com/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_internal_ip_10(self):
        # Internal IP: 10.0.0.1
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://10.0.0.1/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_internal_ip_192_168(self):
        # Internal IP: 192.168.1.1
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://192.168.1.1/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_internal_ip_172_16(self):
        # Internal IP: 172.16.0.1
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://172.16.0.1/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_subdomain_untrusted(self):
        # Subdomain of trusted host is not trusted
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://sub.trusted.com/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_trusted_host_with_port(self):
        # Trusted host with port
        url = "http://trusted.com:8080/rss"
        result = validate_feed_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Empty URL string
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")

    def test_none_input(self):
        # None input
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            validate_feed_url(None)

    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Non-string input (integer)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            validate_feed_url(123)

    def test_public_ip_untrusted(self):
        # Public IP that is not trusted
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://8.8.8.8/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_hostname_with_internal_pattern_in_middle(self):
        # Hostname containing '10.' in the middle
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://abc10.xyz/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_internal_pattern_in_path(self):
        # Internal pattern in path (should be allowed)
        url = "http://trusted.com/10.0.0.1"
        result = validate_feed_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)

    def test_trusted_host_matching_internal_pattern(self):
        # Trusted host that matches internal pattern (special patch)
        with patch('feed_utils.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', {'10.example.com'}):
            with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
                validate_feed_url("http://10.example.com/rss")
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_trusted_host_uppercase(self):
        # Trusted host in uppercase (case sensitivity)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://TRUSTED.COM/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_trusted_host_mixed_case(self):
        # Trusted host in mixed case (case sensitivity)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            validate_feed_url("http://TrUsTeD.cOm/rss")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch
import solution
from solution import check_rss_source

# Set up constants in the solution module
solution.ALLOWED_SCHEMES = ['http', 'https']
solution.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS = ['www.bbc.com', 'www.nytimes.com', 'feeds.reuters.com']
solution.INTERNAL_IP_PATTERNS = [
    r'^10\.',
    r'^192\.168\.',
    r'^172\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])\.',
    r'^127\.',
    r'^localhost$'
]

class TestRssSourceCheck(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_trusted_http(self):
        # Test valid trusted URL with http scheme
        url = 'http://www.bbc.com/rss'
        result = check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)
    
    def test_trusted_https(self):
        # Test valid trusted URL with https scheme
        url = 'https://www.nytimes.com/rss'
        result = check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)
    
    def test_invalid_scheme(self):
        # Test URL with disallowed scheme (ftp)
        url = 'ftp://www.bbc.com/rss'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")
    
    def test_untrusted_domain(self):
        # Test URL from untrusted provider
        url = 'http://www.untrusted.com/rss'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")
    
    def test_internal_ip(self):
        # Test URL with internal IP address
        url = 'http://10.0.0.1/rss'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")
    
    def test_trusted_domain_not_ip(self):
        # Test trusted domain that doesn't match internal patterns
        url = 'http://feeds.reuters.com/rss'
        result = check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)
    
    def test_trusted_internal_ip(self):
        # Test internal IP added to trusted providers (still blocked by internal pattern)
        with patch.object(solution, 'TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', solution.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS + ['10.0.0.1']):
            url = 'http://10.0.0.1/rss'
            with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
                check_rss_source(url)
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty URL string (fails scheme check)
        url = ''
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")
    
    def test_none(self):
        # Test None input (raises AttributeError)
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            check_rss_source(None)
    
    def test_non_string(self):
        # Test non-string input (raises TypeError)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            check_rss_source(123)
    
    def test_url_with_port(self):
        # Test trusted URL with port number
        url = 'http://www.bbc.com:8080/rss'
        result = check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(result, url)
    
    def test_untrusted_ip(self):
        # Test untrusted external IP address
        url = 'http://142.251.32.46/rss'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")
    
    def test_internal_domain_pattern(self):
        # Test domain starting with internal IP pattern
        url = 'http://10.trusted.com/rss'
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            check_rss_source(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")
    
    def test_domain_with_internal_pattern_in_middle(self):
        # Test trusted domain containing internal pattern (not at start)
        with patch.object(solution, 'TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS', solution.TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS + ['sub.10.trusted.com']):
            url = 'http://sub.10.trusted.com/rss'
            result = check_rss_source(url)
            self.assertEqual(result, url)

import unittest
from urllib.parse import urlparse
import re

# Define constants as per the function's requirements
ALLOWED_SCHEMES = {'http', 'https'}
TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS = {
    'www.bbc.com',
    'rss.cnn.com',
    'feeds.feedburner.com',
    'www.nytimes.com',
    'www.reuters.com',
    '8.8.8.8',        # Public IPv4 for testing
    '2001:db8::1',    # Public IPv6 for testing
    '10.0.0.1',       # Internal IPv4 for testing (trusted but blocked)
    'fe80::1'         # Internal IPv6 for testing (trusted but blocked)
}
INTERNAL_IP_PATTERNS = [
    '^10\\.',         # Match internal IPv4 (10.0.0.0/8)
    '^192\\.168\\.',  # Match internal IPv4 (192.168.0.0/16)
    '^172\\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[0-1])\\.',  # Match internal IPv4 (172.16.0.0/12)
    '^127\\.0\\.0\\.1$',  # Loopback IPv4
    '^::1$',          # Loopback IPv6
    '^fc00:',         # Match internal IPv6 (fc00::/7)
    '^fe80:'          # Match link-local IPv6 (fe80::/10)
]

def clean_feed_link(rss_link: str):
    # Parse the provided feed URL
    parsed_url = urlparse(rss_link)
    # Ensure the URL uses an allowed scheme (http or https)
    if parsed_url.scheme not in ALLOWED_SCHEMES:
        raise ValueError("Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")
    
    # Ensure the domain belongs to a trusted RSS feed provider
    if parsed_url.hostname not in TRUSTED_RSS_PROVIDERS:
        raise ValueError("RSS feed provider not trusted")
    
    # Check if the domain or IP address matches internal network patterns
    for pattern in INTERNAL_IP_PATTERNS:
        if re.match(pattern, parsed_url.hostname):
            raise ValueError("Access to internal network addresses is blocked")
    
    return parsed_url.geturl()

class TestCleanFeedLink(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_valid_http_trusted_domain(self):
        # Test valid URL with http and trusted domain
        result = clean_feed_link('http://www.bbc.com')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'http://www.bbc.com')

    def test_valid_https_trusted_domain(self):
        # Test valid URL with https and trusted domain
        result = clean_feed_link('https://www.bbc.com')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'https://www.bbc.com')

    def test_valid_url_with_port(self):
        # Test valid URL with port number
        result = clean_feed_link('http://www.bbc.com:8080')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'http://www.bbc.com:8080')

    def test_valid_url_with_path_query(self):
        # Test valid URL with path and query parameters
        result = clean_feed_link('http://www.bbc.com/news?q=abc')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'http://www.bbc.com/news?q=abc')

    def test_valid_public_ipv4_trusted(self):
        # Test valid URL with trusted public IPv4
        result = clean_feed_link('http://8.8.8.8')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'http://8.8.8.8')

    def test_invalid_scheme_ftp(self):
        # Test URL with invalid scheme (ftp)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('ftp://www.bbc.com')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")

    def test_untrusted_host(self):
        # Test URL with untrusted host
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://www.example.com')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_trusted_host_internal_ipv4_blocked(self):
        # Test trusted host that is an internal IPv4 (blocked by internal pattern)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://10.0.0.1')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_internal_ipv4_untrusted(self):
        # Test internal IPv4 that is not trusted
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://192.168.1.1')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string as input
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Only HTTP or HTTPS schemes are allowed")

    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test None input (expected to raise AttributeError)
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            clean_feed_link(None)

    def test_trusted_host_mixed_case(self):
        # Test trusted host in mixed case (not in trusted set due to case sensitivity)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://WWW.BBC.COM')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_trusted_host_trailing_dot(self):
        # Test trusted host with trailing dot (not in trusted set)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://www.bbc.com.')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

    def test_valid_public_ipv6(self):
        # Test valid URL with trusted public IPv6
        result = clean_feed_link('http://[2001:db8::1]')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'http://[2001:db8::1]')

    def test_trusted_host_internal_ipv6_blocked(self):
        # Test trusted host that is an internal IPv6 (blocked by internal pattern)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://[fe80::1]')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal network addresses is blocked")

    def test_internal_ipv6_untrusted(self):
        # Test internal IPv6 that is not trusted
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            clean_feed_link('http://[fc00::1]')
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "RSS feed provider not trusted")

import unittest
from urllib.parse import urlparse
from unittest.mock import patch

# Define the global variables for the test environment
APPROVED_API_DOMAINS = ['api.example.com', 'webhook.service.com']
INTERNAL_IP_RANGES = ['10.', '192.168.', '172.16.', '172.17.', '172.18.', '172.19.', '172.20.', '172.21.', '172.22.', '172.23.', '172.24.', '172.25.', '172.26.', '172.27.', '172.28.', '172.29.', '172.30.', '172.31.', '127.0.0.']

# Define the function as per the provided code snippet
def process_webhook(webhook_url: str):
    parsed_url = urlparse(webhook_url)
    if parsed_url.hostname not in APPROVED_API_DOMAINS:
        raise ValueError("Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")
    if parsed_url.hostname == "localhost" or any(parsed_url.hostname.startswith(ip) for ip in INTERNAL_IP_RANGES):
        raise ValueError("Access to internal addresses is blocked")
    return parsed_url.geturl()

class TestProcessWebhook(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_case_1(self):
        # Happy path: valid approved domain (api.example.com)
        url = "https://api.example.com/api"
        self.assertEqual(process_webhook(url), url)

    def test_case_2(self):
        # Happy path: valid approved domain (webhook.service.com)
        url = "https://webhook.service.com/webhook"
        self.assertEqual(process_webhook(url), url)

    def test_case_3(self):
        # Domain not in approved list
        url = "https://unapproved.com"
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_4(self):
        # Empty string input
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook("")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_5(self):
        # None input (invalid type)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            process_webhook(None)

    def test_case_6(self):
        # Integer input (invalid type)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            process_webhook(123)

    def test_case_7(self):
        # Mixed case domain (not in approved list)
        url = "https://API.example.com"
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook(url)
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_8(self):
        # Very long URL with approved domain
        long_path = '/'.join(['path'] * 1000)
        url = f"https://api.example.com/{long_path}"
        self.assertEqual(process_webhook(url), url)

    def test_case_9(self):
        # Approved domain with internal IP in path (should pass)
        url = "https://api.example.com/10.0.0.1"
        self.assertEqual(process_webhook(url), url)

    def test_case_10(self):
        # Localhost (not approved)
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook("http://localhost")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_11(self):
        # Internal IP (10.0.0.1) not approved
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook("http://10.0.0.1")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_12(self):
        # Internal IP (192.168.1.1) not approved
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook("http://192.168.1.1")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_13(self):
        # Internal IP (127.0.0.1) not approved
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
            process_webhook("http://127.0.0.1")
        self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Webhook URL not from an approved API domain")

    def test_case_14(self):
        # Approved domain 'localhost' blocked by internal check
        with patch('__main__.APPROVED_API_DOMAINS', ['localhost']):
            with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
                process_webhook("http://localhost")
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal addresses is blocked")

    def test_case_15(self):
        # Approved domain starting with '10.' blocked by internal check
        with patch('__main__.APPROVED_API_DOMAINS', ['10.approved.com']):
            with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as context:
                process_webhook("http://10.approved.com")
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "Access to internal addresses is blocked")

        # Test a domain not in the allowed list

        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):

        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):

        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):

import unittest
from urllib.parse import urlparse

# Predefined allowed schemes and domains
ALLOWED_SCHEMES = {'http', 'https'}
ALLOWED_DOMAINS = {'example.com', 'safe.org'}

def parse_url(url: str):
    """Parse and validate the URL."""
    parsed_url = urlparse(url)
    if parsed_url.scheme not in ALLOWED_SCHEMES or parsed_url.hostname not in ALLOWED_DOMAINS:
        raise ValueError("URL scheme or domain not allowed")
    return parsed_url

class TestParseUrl(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_valid_http_example_com(self):
        # Test valid URL with http and example.com
        url = "http://example.com"
        parsed = parse_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(parsed.scheme, "http")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.hostname, "example.com")
    
    def test_valid_https_safe_org(self):
        # Test valid URL with https and safe.org including path and query
        url = "https://safe.org/path?query=param"
        parsed = parse_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(parsed.scheme, "https")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.hostname, "safe.org")
    
    def test_invalid_scheme_ftp(self):
        # Test URL with disallowed scheme (ftp)
        url = "ftp://example.com"
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_invalid_domain(self):
        # Test URL with disallowed domain (evil.com)
        url = "http://evil.com"
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty URL string
        url = ""
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test None input
        url = None
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test non-string input (integer)
        url = 123
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_missing_scheme(self):
        # Test URL without a scheme
        url = "example.com"
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_valid_with_port(self):
        # Test valid URL with port number
        url = "http://example.com:8080"
        parsed = parse_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(parsed.scheme, "http")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.hostname, "example.com")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.port, 8080)
    
    def test_valid_with_user_password(self):
        # Test valid URL with user and password
        url = "http://user:pass@example.com"
        parsed = parse_url(url)
        self.assertEqual(parsed.scheme, "http")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.hostname, "example.com")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.username, "user")
        self.assertEqual(parsed.password, "pass")
    
    def test_invalid_subdomain(self):
        # Test URL with disallowed subdomain (www.example.com)
        url = "http://www.example.com"
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            parse_url(url)
    
    def test_invalid_domain_substring(self):
        # Test URL where domain contains allowed domain as substring (safe.org.evil.com)

import unittest

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_case_1(self):
        # Valid typical log entry
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01T12:00:00] : User logged in'
        expected = ('INFO', '2023-01-01T12:00:00', 'User logged in')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_2(self):
        # Valid with empty message
        log_text = 'WARN[2023-01-01T12:00:00] : '
        expected = ('WARN', '2023-01-01T12:00:00', '')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_3(self):
        # Valid with spaces in log_level and message
        log_text = '   INFO   [2023-01-01] :   message   '
        expected = ('   INFO   ', '2023-01-01', '  message   ')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_4(self):
        # Valid with special characters in log_level
        log_text = 'INFO!@#[timestamp] : message'
        expected = ('INFO!@#', 'timestamp', 'message')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_5(self):
        # Valid with space in timestamp
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01 12:00:00] : message'
        expected = ('INFO', '2023-01-01 12:00:00', 'message')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_6(self):
        # Valid with newline in message
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01] : line1\nline2'
        expected = ('INFO', '2023-01-01', 'line1\nline2')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_7(self):
        # Valid with log_level consisting of spaces
        log_text = '   [2023-01-01] : message'
        expected = ('   ', '2023-01-01', 'message')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_8(self):
        # Valid with empty timestamp
        log_text = 'INFO[] : message'
        expected = ('INFO', '', 'message')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_9(self):
        # Valid with inner bracket in timestamp
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01 [inner]] : message'
        expected = ('INFO', '2023-01-01 [inner', 'message')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_10(self):
        # Invalid: log_level missing (starts with '[')
        log_text = '[2023-01-01] : message'
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_text))

    def test_case_11(self):
        # Invalid: missing opening bracket
        log_text = 'INFO2023-01-01] : message'
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_text))

    def test_case_12(self):
        # Invalid: missing closing bracket
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01 : message'
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_text))

    def test_case_13(self):
        # Invalid: missing colon
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01] message'
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_text))

    def test_case_14(self):
        # Invalid: empty string
        log_text = ''
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_text))

    def test_case_15(self):
        # Invalid: None (non-string input)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            extract_log_data(None)

    def test_case_16(self):
        # Invalid: integer input (non-string)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            extract_log_data(123)

    def test_case_17(self):
        # Invalid: multiple colons in message
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01] : message : with : colons'
        expected = ('INFO', '2023-01-01', 'message : with : colons')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

    def test_case_18(self):
        # Invalid: extra spaces around colon
        log_text = 'INFO[2023-01-01]   :   message'
        expected = ('INFO', '2023-01-01', '  message')
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_text), expected)

import unittest

class TestAnalyzeLogEntry(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_valid_minimal(self):
        """Test minimal valid log entry."""
        entry = "[t] L: m"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('t', 'L', 'm'))

    def test_valid_maximal_lengths(self):
        """Test valid entry with max timestamp (23), log_level (10), message (1000)."""
        timestamp = 'a' * 23
        log_level = 'b' * 10
        message = 'c' * 1000
        entry = f"[{timestamp}] {log_level}: {message}"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), (timestamp, log_level, message))

    def test_valid_typical(self):
        """Test typical valid log entry."""
        entry = "[2021-01-01 12:00:00] INFO: Application started"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('2021-01-01 12:00:00', 'INFO', 'Application started'))

    def test_timestamp_too_long(self):
        """Test timestamp exceeding 23 characters."""
        entry = "[" + 'a' * 24 + "] L: m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_timestamp_empty(self):
        """Test empty timestamp."""
        entry = "[] L: m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_log_level_too_long(self):
        """Test log_level exceeding 10 characters."""
        entry = "[ts] " + 'b' * 11 + ": m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_log_level_empty(self):
        """Test empty log_level."""
        entry = "[ts] : m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_message_1001_chars(self):
        """Test message exceeding 1000 characters - should truncate to 1000."""
        entry = "[ts] L: " + 'c' * 1001
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('ts', 'L', 'c' * 1000))

    def test_message_empty(self):
        """Test empty message."""
        entry = "[ts] L: "
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_empty_entry(self):
        """Test empty log entry."""
        entry = ""
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_missing_opening_bracket(self):
        """Test entry without opening bracket."""
        entry = "ts] L: m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_missing_colon_after_level(self):
        """Test missing colon after log_level."""
        entry = "[ts] L m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_missing_space_after_colon(self):
        """Test missing space after colon."""
        entry = "[ts] L:m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_tab_after_colon(self):
        """Test tab instead of space after colon."""
        entry = "[ts] L:\tm"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

    def test_log_level_with_space(self):
        """Test log_level containing space."""
        entry = "[ts] LOG LEVEL: m"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('ts', 'LOG LEVEL', 'm'))

    def test_log_level_with_newline(self):
        """Test log_level containing newline."""
        entry = "[ts] LOG\nLEVEL: m"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('ts', 'LOG\nLEVEL', 'm'))

    def test_timestamp_with_newline(self):
        """Test timestamp containing newline."""
        entry = "[t\ns] L: m"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('t\ns', 'L', 'm'))

    def test_message_with_newline(self):
        """Test message containing newline - captures until newline."""
        entry = "[ts] L: m1\nm2"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('ts', 'L', 'm1'))

    def test_extra_text_after_message(self):
        """Test extra text after message - captured as part of message."""
        entry = "[ts] L: message extra"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('ts', 'L', 'message extra'))

    def test_non_printable_chars(self):
        """Test non-printable characters in all parts."""
        entry = "[\x00] \x01: \x02"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('\x00', '\x01', '\x02'))

    def test_timestamp_with_brackets(self):
        """Test timestamp containing brackets (non-closing bracket chars)."""
        entry = "[[a]] L: m"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_entry(entry), ('[a', 'L', 'm'))

    def test_log_level_with_colon(self):
        """Test log_level containing colon - should fail."""
        entry = "[ts] IN:FO: m"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_entry(entry))

import unittest

class TestExtractLogData(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_valid_standard(self):
        """Test a standard log line with valid components."""
        log_line = "[2020-01-01 12:00:00] INFO: User logged in"
        expected = ("2020-01-01 12:00:00", "INFO", "User logged in")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_min_timestamp(self):
        """Test timestamp at minimum length (1 character)."""
        log_line = "[a] B: c"
        expected = ("a", "B", "c")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_max_timestamp(self):
        """Test timestamp at maximum length (23 characters)."""
        timestamp = 'a' * 23
        log_line = f"[{timestamp}] B: c"
        expected = (timestamp, "B", "c")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_min_log_level(self):
        """Test log level at minimum length (1 character)."""
        log_line = "[ts] l: msg"
        expected = ("ts", "l", "msg")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_max_log_level(self):
        """Test log level at maximum length (10 characters)."""
        log_level = 'a' * 10
        log_line = f"[ts] {log_level}: msg"
        expected = ("ts", log_level, "msg")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_min_message(self):
        """Test message at minimum length (1 character)."""
        log_line = "[ts] l: m"
        expected = ("ts", "l", "m")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_max_message(self):
        """Test message at maximum length (1000 characters)."""
        message = 'a' * 1000
        log_line = f"[ts] l: {message}"
        expected = ("ts", "l", message)
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_message_with_newline(self):
        """Test message containing a newline (pattern stops at newline)."""
        log_line = "[ts] l: hello\nworld"
        expected = ("ts", "l", "hello")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_valid_message_with_special_chars(self):
        """Test message with special characters (colon, bracket)."""
        log_line = "[ts] l: This: is a {message} with ] special chars"
        expected = ("ts", "l", "This: is a {message} with ] special chars")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        """Test empty log line returns None."""
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(""))

    def test_missing_opening_bracket(self):
        """Test missing opening bracket returns None."""
        log_line = "2020-01-01 12:00:00] INFO: User logged in"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_missing_closing_bracket(self):
        """Test missing closing bracket returns None."""
        log_line = "[2020-01-01 12:00:00 INFO: User logged in"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_missing_colon_after_log_level(self):
        """Test missing colon after log level returns None."""
        log_line = "[2020-01-01 12:00:00] INFO User logged in"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_timestamp_too_long(self):
        """Test timestamp exceeding 23 characters returns None."""
        timestamp = 'a' * 24
        log_line = f"[{timestamp}] l: msg"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_log_level_too_long(self):
        """Test log level exceeding 10 characters returns None."""
        log_level = 'a' * 11
        log_line = f"[ts] {log_level}: msg"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_message_too_long(self):
        """Test message exceeding 1000 characters returns None."""
        message = 'a' * 1001
        log_line = f"[ts] l: {message}"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_message_too_short(self):
        """Test empty message (after colon) returns None."""
        log_line = "[ts] l: "
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_log_level_containing_colon(self):
        """Test log level containing colon returns None."""
        log_line = "[ts] l:v: msg"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_extra_text_after_message(self):
        """Test extra text after message is included in the message group."""
        log_line = "[ts] l: msg extra"
        expected = ("ts", "l", "msg extra")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_timestamp_with_opening_bracket(self):
        """Test timestamp containing opening bracket (allowed)."""
        log_line = "[in[valid] l: msg"
        expected = ("in[valid", "l", "msg")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_timestamp_containing_closing_bracket(self):
        """Test timestamp containing closing bracket (invalid, breaks pattern)."""
        log_line = "[invalid]timestamp] l: msg"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_log_data(log_line))

    def test_log_level_with_space(self):
        """Test log level containing space (allowed)."""
        log_line = "[ts] lo g: msg"
        expected = ("ts", "lo g", "msg")
        self.assertEqual(extract_log_data(log_line), expected)

    def test_non_string_inputs(self):
        """Test non-string inputs raise TypeError."""
        invalid_inputs = [None, 123, 0, -1]
        for inp in invalid_inputs:
            with self.subTest(input=inp):
                with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                    extract_log_data(inp)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest

class TestAnalyzeLogData(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_valid_standard_entry(self):
        # Basic valid log entry with standard format
        s = "[2023-01-01 12:00:00] INFO: This is a message"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_data(s), ("2023-01-01 12:00:00", "INFO", "This is a message"))
    
    def test_valid_max_lengths(self):
        # Valid entry with max length timestamp (23), log level (10), and message (1000)
        timestamp = 'a' * 23
        log_level = 'b' * 10
        message = 'c' * 1000
        s = f"[{timestamp}] {log_level}: {message}"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_data(s), (timestamp, log_level, message))
    
    def test_valid_min_lengths(self):
        # Valid entry with min length (1 char) for all parts
        s = "[a] b: c"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_data(s), ("a", "b", "c"))
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Empty input string should return None
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(""))
    
    def test_timestamp_too_long(self):
        # Timestamp longer than 23 chars should return None
        s = "[" + 'a' * 24 + "] INFO: message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_log_level_too_long(self):
        # Log level longer than 10 chars should return None
        s = "[ts] " + 'b' * 11 + ": message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_empty_message(self):
        # Missing message content (0 chars) should return None
        s = "[ts] level: "
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_empty_log_level(self):
        # Missing log level (0 chars) should return None
        s = "[ts] : message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_empty_timestamp(self):
        # Missing timestamp content (0 chars) should return None
        s = "[] level: message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_message_extra_text(self):
        # Message with extra text beyond 1000 chars - captures first 1000 chars
        timestamp = "ts"
        log_level = "level"
        message_part = 'c' * 1000
        extra = "extra"
        s = f"[{timestamp}] {log_level}: {message_part}{extra}"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_data(s), (timestamp, log_level, message_part))
    
    def test_colon_in_log_level(self):
        # Colon in log level part should break parsing and return None
        s = "[ts] log:level: message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_missing_timestamp_space(self):
        # Missing space after timestamp bracket should return None
        s = "[ts]level: message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_missing_colon_space(self):
        # Missing space after colon should return None
        s = "[ts] level:message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_bracket_in_timestamp(self):
        # Closing bracket inside timestamp content should return None
        s = "[a]b] level: message"
        self.assertIsNone(analyze_log_data(s))
    
    def test_log_level_with_space(self):
        # Log level containing spaces should parse correctly
        s = "[ts] log level: message"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_data(s), ("ts", "log level", "message"))
    
    def test_message_with_newline(self):
        # Message with newline - captures only until newline
        s = "[ts] level: line1\nline2"
        self.assertEqual(analyze_log_data(s), ("ts", "level", "line1"))

import unittest

class TestExtractEmailDomain(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_valid_email_simple(self):
        # Test valid email with simple domain
        email = "user@example.com"
        expected = "example.com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_valid_email_with_subdomain(self):
        # Test valid email with subdomain
        email = "user@sub.example.com"
        expected = "sub.example.com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_email_without_at(self):
        # Test email missing '@' symbol
        email = "userexample.com"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_email_domain(email))
        
    def test_email_with_multiple_ats(self):
        # Test email containing multiple '@' symbols
        email = "user@name@example.com"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_email_domain(email))
        
    def test_email_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty email string
        email = ""
        self.assertIsNone(extract_email_domain(email))
        
    def test_email_only_at(self):
        # Test email containing only '@' symbol
        email = "@"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_email_domain(email))
        
    def test_email_domain_only(self):
        # Test email missing local part (only domain)
        email = "@example.com"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_email_domain(email))
        
    def test_email_local_only(self):
        # Test email missing domain part (only local)
        email = "user@"
        self.assertIsNone(extract_email_domain(email))
        
    def test_email_with_spaces_in_local(self):
        # Test valid email with spaces in local part
        email = "user name@example.com"
        expected = "example.com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_email_with_spaces_in_domain(self):
        # Test valid email with spaces in domain part
        email = "user@exa mple.com"
        expected = "exa mple.com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_email_with_special_chars_local(self):
        # Test valid email with special characters in local part
        email = "!#$%^&*()@domain.com"
        expected = "domain.com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_email_with_special_chars_domain(self):
        # Test valid email with special characters in domain part
        email = "user@!#$%^&*().com"
        expected = "!#$%^&*().com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_email_with_non_ascii(self):
        # Test valid email with non-ASCII characters
        email = "@exmple.com"
        expected = "exmple.com"
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_long_email(self):
        # Test very long email (efficiency and correctness)
        long_local = "a" * 10000
        long_domain = "b" * 10000
        email = long_local + "@" + long_domain
        expected = long_domain
        self.assertEqual(extract_email_domain(email), expected)
        
    def test_non_string_input_none(self):
        # Test None input (non-string)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            extract_email_domain(None)
            
    def test_non_string_input_integer(self):
        # Test integer input (non-string)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            extract_email_domain(123)

import unittest

class TestParseLogEntry(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_case_1(self):
        # Test with a basic valid log entry
        log_entry = 'INFO[2023-01-01] : Application started'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('INFO', '2023-01-01', 'Application started'))

    def test_case_2(self):
        # Test with empty message
        log_entry = 'WARN[2023-01-01 12:00:00] : '
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('WARN', '2023-01-01 12:00:00', ''))

    def test_case_3(self):
        # Test with message containing special characters
        log_entry = 'ERROR[2023-01-01] : Failed to connect to database: error 404'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('ERROR', '2023-01-01', 'Failed to connect to database: error 404'))

    def test_case_4(self):
        # Test with empty timestamp
        log_entry = 'DEBUG[] : This is a debug message'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('DEBUG', '', 'This is a debug message'))

    def test_case_5(self):
        # Test with log level containing hyphen
        log_entry = 'DEBUG-1[2023-01-01] : Message'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('DEBUG-1', '2023-01-01', 'Message'))

    def test_case_6(self):
        # Test missing colon (invalid format)
        log_entry = 'INFO[2023-01-01] Message without colon'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_case_7(self):
        # Test with leading/trailing spaces
        log_entry = '  INFO  [2023-01-01] :   message with spaces   '
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('  INFO  ', '2023-01-01', '  message with spaces   '))

    def test_case_8(self):
        # Test with missing closing bracket (invalid)
        log_entry = 'INFO[2023-01-01 : This is a message'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_case_9(self):
        # Test empty string input
        log_entry = ''
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_case_10(self):
        # Test very long log entry
        long_str = 'A' * 1000
        log_entry = f'LONG[{long_str}] : {long_str}'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('LONG', long_str, long_str))

    def test_case_11(self):
        # Test log level with newline
        log_entry = 'INFO\n[2023-01-01] : message'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('INFO\n', '2023-01-01', 'message'))

    def test_case_12(self):
        # Test message containing brackets
        log_entry = 'INFO[2023-01-01] : This is a [message] with brackets'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertEqual(result, ('INFO', '2023-01-01', 'This is a [message] with brackets'))

    def test_case_13(self):
        # Test missing space after colon (invalid)
        log_entry = 'INFO[2023-01-01]: message without space'
        result = parse_log_entry(log_entry)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()
